alert.note: Alert for Isle of Wight (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 12 at 10:33PM EST until further notice by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northeast North Carolina, including the following counties, Hertford and Northampton and southeast Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, City of Franklin, Greensville, Isle of Wight and Southampton. * WHEN...Until 130 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1032 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen during the past hour. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area through 1130 PM. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Franklin, Smithfield, Windsor, Courtland, Garysburg, Boykins, Dahlia, Suffolk, Isle Of Wight, Gaston, Conway, Seaboard, Ivor, Newsoms, Hunterdale, Sedley, Carrsville, Green Plain, Claresville and Zuni. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
